reviewText: Engelbert Humperdinck in this live performance from the Forum in Los Angeles in 1995, has the same amazing vocal range, breath control and smooth sound he had in the late '60s and '70s when he had his own television show, and pop hits like "Release Me" and the romantic ballads that made him a superstar, in fact he is quoted in the liner notes as saying "time gives you more experience, and I sing with more depth now because I draw on that experience whenever possible".This is a terrific concert, and a lot of the credit goes to the fabulous arranger/musical director Bebu Silvetti, who has done so much marvelous work with top Latin music stars like Luis Miguel and Rocio Durcal. He weaves his magic here with lush arrangements and superb musicianship, and in the section that takes place in a recording studio ("Smoke Gets in Your Eyes") and the duo with Engelbert and Bebu on piano ("The Shadow of Your Smile"), one can tell that these two men have a rapport and admiration of each others' skills and talent.Engelbert is also backed by an wonderful trio of singers, and one of them, Michaela, gets to show how well she can sing solo with a stupendous "Malagueña", and she also sings a duet with Engelbert ("When I Fall in Love").In "Quando, Quando, Quando", he really lets loose, dancing as well as singing. He looks good in the first half in black with a silver waistcoat, and in the second half in a purple flounced shirt. The final two numbers are extraordinary..."Unchained Melody" is fantastic, and his "Ave Maria" encore sublime.Total running time is 2 hours.The DVD extras include a long interview that takes place in Engelbert's home in England, a great old house on 25 acres of land, with many gardens designed by his wife; he tells stories of his life, which is quite fascinating, and a combination of hard work, fate, and God's blessings.There is also a "photo gallery" with a few photos, most of them seen in the interview section.Song list:"Love is a Many Splendored Thing""Can't Take My Eyes Off of You""Stranger in Paradise""Por el Amor de Una Mujer" ("I Knew That We Have Loved Before")"Nothin' a Little Love Won't Cure""Portofino""(Sittin' on) the Dock of the Bay""Release Me""The Shadow of Your Smile""Smoke Gets in Your Eyes""I Apologize""Too Young""Secret Love""Malagueña""No Other Love""When I Fall in Love""Quando, Quando, Quando""After the Lovin'""Such a Night""Yours" ("Quiereme Mucho")"Unchained Melody""Ave Maria"
summary: 28 years after "Release Me", and as good as ever
Title: N/A

reviewText: Of all my reviews of Engelbert this is the best DVD of him out there.From the moment the perfect orchestration begins from Babe Salvetti Engelbert brings it powerfully. Even though this DVD is made around the time he is aging somehwat he has lost nothing vocally. He is definatley one of the greatest vocalist ever to live and this DVD will show you why.He and Tom Jones, Tony Bennett and Elvis are in a class all by themsleves. This DVD is the perfect example of showmanship and talent musically and vocally, i highly recommend it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This concert was wonderful!!!!! The selection of songs are the most beautiful and so romantic. The Bebu Silvetti Orchestra was outstanding. I highly recommend this DVD. You won't be disappointed and you just can't go wrong getting this DVD. After just a few songs, Engelbert warms up andreally put on a superb performance. Then there is the special performance with Michaela who sang a Nat King Cole Song entitled "When I Fall in Love" with Engelbert and then she sings the Spanish song"Malaguena" alone which was sung absolutely perfect. She has quite a vocal range in this and really impressed me. This DVD is a must have. It has all the songs you need to hear him sing. I love it second best to the Tom Jones Live in Cardiff Castle DVD which is also out now and another absolute must have with all the Tom Jones greatest songs and some newer ones too, like The Boy From Nowhere and Kiss. He still has it also in a big way.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Simply put, .... this is a great DVD.It's a beautiful concert, recorded magnificently, both visually and audibly.This is Englebert with a full and stunning orchestra. It's a wonderful concert with many many songs of differing styles and rhythms. But mainly he falls on the ballads that we all love to hear. His voice is in fine form, he has some nicely placed dancers to enhance certain moods and the orchestration is rich and mature.This is just lovely.Then to cap things off, there is a one on one walk through his house and garden. We listen in on an interview with him at his home, as if we are in the room with Englebert. It's a great DVD one that I am sure any romantic will enjoy.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD was and is pure magic. Englebert is in good form and excellent voice. I was mesmerized by his presence on camera.  I loved the way he looked and how he carries himself.  I was elated with the selection of the songs and with Michaelina who sang Malaguena and in a duet of Ave Maria at the very end encore presentation.  I fell in love with the whole production and I am getting this DVD for my sister for Christmas and watch her fall in love.

reviewText: This was recorded 28 years ago and it still sounded great. My Aunt and Uncle love this guy and after buying this live concert  Ican understand why.I have a very nice home system even in my bed room. I like to play live concerts when I am getting dress before I go out dancing.My only complaint is that I wish that he would have sung more slow love songs. Still and excellent Concert !
